intro: Chaptalia ekmanii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. It is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments. Chaptalia ekmanii plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats by providing nectar for pollinators.
